thag7.2:1.1: Bhaddiya has plucked out craving, root and all,
thag7.2:1.3: on the far side of the Wild Mango Monastery,
thag7.2:1.4: he practices absorption; he is truly well-favoured.
thag7.2:2.2: in arched harps, and in cymbals.
thag7.2:2.3: But here, at the foot of a tree,
thag7.2:2.4: I delight in the Buddha’s teaching.
thag7.2:3.1: If the Buddha were to grant me one wish,
thag7.2:3.2: and I were to get what I wished for,
thag7.2:3.3: I’d choose for the whole world
thag7.2:4.1: Those who’ve judged me on appearance,
thag7.2:4.2: and those swayed by my voice,
thag7.2:4.3: are full of desire and greed;
thag7.2:5.3: the fool shut in on every side,
thag7.2:5.4: gets carried away by a voice.
thag7.2:6.4: they’re also carried away by a voice.
thag7.2:7.4: they don’t get carried away by a voice.
